response.answer_text: There cannot be energy without a body, a body cannot be “space/time”, as that’s an abstraction of the actually existing body. All bodies have a deterministic quiddity. Spinoza called “space/time” the sum of the Natura Naturan plus all actually existing Natura Naturata. This sum is the whole Cosmos considered as a solid Substance Monism and the Unified Field of all possible and actually existing quantum particles. Space/time is our human mental objective idea for the infinite, indivisible, eternal, and almighty Radiant Quantum Materialistic Monism which has logically the energy of the said body.

spacetime is a flow, it is a mixture of 3-dimensional space and time (relative) at that particular point. Its flow varies with gravity, the flow of spacetime is slow around the bodies with higher gravitational fields and vice-versa.
